reviews.review_msg: Dr. Menz really cares about her students' learning experience. The course was very well organized and the test material was clearly connected to the assignments. But in the end this is a very hard math course; you have to put in the effort. Dr. Menz is not warm & fuzzy, but she is approachable. If you are working hard she wants to help you do well.

DO NOT take her classes! Her lecture slides are clear and easy to study on your own but you have to print out her slides with blanks and fill it out in class. She does not provide the finished notes from class, so you can't skip any class if you want the notes. Practice questions help term tests but final is cumulative and too much to study

Quit a lot hand writing notes. He never puts his note on canvas so you cant miss nearly any class. The most funny thing is he gives us the review questions before the midterm without any answers. And he also make a lot of mistakes in his handwriting notes, if no one point out that, he just lets it go.
His lectures are organized and he explains every example step by step. although he talks a lot in the class, he is patient to students. He is definitely a great prof!
best prof i've ever seen

The best! Take his course if you are not strong in Math. Everything is from his lecture note so make sure you go to class and write down everything that he says and writes. Also do all assignments and get help from TAs at Workshop. Then, I guarantee you get at least B.

First two months were okay but after that he started being very sloppy, vague explanations, assigns questions that we weren't taught in class. Did not teach us how to do the very basic assignment questions, leaving students clueless and confused. Makes many mistakes during lectures

He was very, very, very, VERY clear. SO CLEAR. Assignments, midterms and final were all very easy they just take time. Make sure you put the time in as you go along to understand everything and you barely have to study. Allowed cheat sheet into exam which makes it easy to remember all the "formulas". He was a bit boring, but SO THOROUGH.
Excellent Prof!!! midterms are easy~ assignments are little bit long but really helpful. the best part is he allows you bring a two-side cheat-sheet on final~~!!! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
Best Prof I have ever seenVery good

This guy probaly got bad ratings cause he got 1 for clarity. Can't explain****..2/3 of the class doesn't come for hte lectures cause it's just terrible. Notes suck ass, and he talks to himself rather than teaching. His exams (especially final) are reasonable though, as is his curving.
His notes are messy and he explains things very quickly.  Otherwise, his tests are reasonable.

Extremely difficult exams;poor examination protocol (changed actual numbering on exam 3 times during midterm!!!) Notes are useless and teaches way to fast to comprehend...unless you are a genius in math or an international student who spends every hour studying calculus. AWFUL!!
can't learn anything at all from his lecture, he's just like talking to himself instead of teaching & his notes r super messy~ i learned everything from the textbook only~
One of the worst prof. i've had. He makes things very unclear and no body can read his writing. Go over stuff extremely fast. HE CAN'T TEACH!!!!

This course is too easy for him, everyone is supposed to understand everything already. Pretty hard to follow if you are not major in math, and the exam is brutal...don't expect to take this 100 level to raise your GPA.
Felt uncomfortable approaching him, did not care about students success. Very tough grader, would avoid this professor
unit test are from text book questions, but doesn't post any notes or practice exams on canvas. The only ways to get them is to attend his lectures. He doesn't care about students.

He's an average professor; he teaches in detail but he doesn't post any notes on Canvas. If you miss a lecture, the only way to get notes is from other people. We have OQ every week, about 15 question each. He gives a unit test on every chapter, totaling six tests. The final exam is weighted at 50 percent, which is a lot compared to other courses.
Not very clear in teaching and makes it hard to follow along

I miss her FUN lecture! Hard exams but she definitely want you to learn a lot and prepare for the upper level courses! Work hard and you'll be ok! Trust me you'll miss her when you are taking other math courses with boring profs

Chiaka is hands down the best calculus professor out there. She is highly energetic and genuinely wants her students to learn. Her notes are very clear and she is available for extra help in the math lab. Taking the class with anyone else is a mistake!
Never never never never take with her. Midterms are very very hard compared to other math session. And she never give the stats of the midterm. The reason might be that the average is very low.

She is a great professor. Easy to understand, and she's funny so the class is enjoyable. However, her tests are extremely fast so be prepared to memorize questions and the procedures for them rather than understand the process and apply it.
Bell is good teacher!
